pullRequest.body:
This adds results of the kind "if `f` is an entire function with all iterated derivatives at a point `c` nonnegative real, then `f z` is nonnegative real for `z = c + r` with `r` nonnegative real".

From [EulerProducts](https://github.com/MichaelStollBayreuth/EulerProducts).

This will be needed for the proof that $L(\chi, 1) \ne 0$ for nontrivial quadratic Dirichlet characters $\chi$ (which in turn is necessary for Dirichlet's Theorem on primes in arithmetic progressions; see [PNT+](https://github.com/AlexKontorovich/PrimeNumberTheoremAnd)). 

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

maintainer merge

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11426679743/job/31789887327)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11426679743/job/31789887487)
I found a few more small golfs, otherwise I think this is looking good
a few comments, more to come later
I found a few more small golfs, otherwise I think this is looking good

Declaring `x` as an element of `s` coerced to a subtype seems nonoptimal, we should probably go for ` {x : 𝕜} (hx : x ∈ s)`. 

I also feel this should be formulated using "EventuallyEq"; maybe we should add something like
```lean
lemma Filter.EventuallyEq.iteratedDeriv_eq (n : ℕ) {f g : 𝕜 → F} {x : 𝕜}
    (hfg : f =ᶠ[nhds x] g) : iteratedDeriv n f x = iteratedDeriv n g x := by
  simp only [← iteratedDerivWithin_univ, iteratedDerivWithin_eq_iteratedFDerivWithin]
  rw [(hfg.filter_mono nhdsWithin_le_nhds).iteratedFDerivWithin_eq hfg.eq_of_nhds n]
```
instead? Possibly going via the `iteratedDerivWithin` version (which would need `f x = g x` as a hypothesis).
Could just have both versions? the original one is a bit easier to use.
OK: added the filter version (and reduced the proof of the original one to it), changed to `{x : 𝕜} (hx : x ∈ s)`.
why "rewrite" not "rw" (or even "simpa only")?
This is a "non-terminal" rewrite, so ther is no need to `try rfl`. But `simpa only` is probably better here.
It feels like the `obtain` here is just a layer of indirection concealing an explicit formula. It might be simpler just to work directly with `(iteratedDeriv n f c).re`.
Simplified the proof.

golfs to one (long) line:
```suggestion
simpa only [iteratedDeriv_succ, IH] using funext <| deriv_comp_add_const _ s
```
OK (applies to both proofs).

```suggestion
  rw [Metric.mem_ball, dist_eq, eq_re_of_ofReal_le hz]
  simpa only [Complex.abs_of_nonneg (nonneg_iff.mp hz).1] using lt_add_one _
```

```suggestion
      rwa [funext fun x ↦ deriv_sub_const (f := f) (x := x) (f c)]
```

```suggestion
  convert apply_le_of_iteratedDeriv_nonneg (f := fun z ↦ f (-z))
    (hf.comp <| differentiable_neg) (fun n hn ↦ ?_) (neg_le_neg_iff.mpr hz) using 1
  · simp only [neg_neg]
  · simp only [neg_neg]
  · simpa only [iteratedDeriv_comp_neg, neg_neg, smul_eq_mul] using h n hn
```
Please use notation for `nhds`.
OK; this needs `open Topology in`,  but I guess this is OK.
I would formulate it as `Set.EqOn.iteratedDeriv_of_isOpen : (hfg : Set.EqOn f g s) (hs : IsOpen s) (n : ℕ) : Set.EqOn (iteratedDeriv n f) (iteratedDeriv n g) s`.
OK, done.
